title: Vintage Play Kitchens & Toy Cooking
description: From Easy-Bake Ovens to toy pots and pans, test your knowledge of the toys that turned children into little chefs!

questions.question: The Easy-Bake Oven was introduced by Kenner in 1963. What was the original color of the first Easy-Bake Oven?
What type of cake mixes came with the Easy-Bake Oven for children to bake?
options: Tiny packets that made miniature cakes

questions.question: The Creepy Crawlers Thingmaker oven, introduced by Mattel in 1964, used a similar heating concept but made what instead of food?
What was the name of Mattel's food-making companion to Creepy Crawlers that let kids make edible treats?
Toy kitchen sets in the 1950s often featured a miniature version of what popular kitchen appliance?
What company produced the popular 'Little Lady' line of toy kitchen appliances in the 1950s?
Sno-Cone machines for kids, which shaved ice for flavored treats, were introduced by which company?
Play-Doh, originally marketed as a wallpaper cleaner, was repurposed as a children's toy in what decade?
What was the Fun Factory, a popular Play-Doh accessory?
options: An extruder that squeezed Play-Doh through shaped openings

questions.question: Children's toy pots and pans in the 1950s were typically made from what material?
What popular 1960s toy allowed kids to make candy using small molds and a special gel?
The Suzy Homemaker line of toy appliances was produced by which company?
What real food brand licensed its name for a popular children's toy baking set in the 1950s?
Easy-Bake Oven recipes typically took how long to bake using the light bulb heat source?
What classic toy let children make tiny cups of flavored gelatin and other miniature foods?
